info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 11:48AM MDT until June 15 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Unprecedented flooding for the following rivers in Montana... Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry affecting Carbon County. .Heavy rain falling on the snowpack over the Beartooth/Absaroka mountains has resulted in unprecedented rises on rivers and streams in the region. The river is cresting 3 feet above previous record high flows which occurred in 1981 and 2020. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Belfry, Edgar... Unprecedented flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Unprecedented flooding is expected. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM MDT Monday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening, then peak near 10.9 feet around midnight Monday night. It is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest well exceeds a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone Edgar 9.0 9.4 Mon 10 am 9.6 7.7 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Undercut banks can collapse and you will find yourself in a deadly situation in fast moving cold water. Stay away from river banks until the river recedes to normal summer flows, especially children. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
